name: Housekeeping Camp

reviews.title: Great location, great place for summer
reviews.text: Yosemite is a place where we want to go every year. We are quite new to California and for the last 2 years we were very happy to visit Yosemite. Last time we looked for rooms one night before our travel and found a bed and breakfast room at Oakhurst. This time we planned well in advance and we booked at Housekeeping camp. Though we aren't adventurous campers we had so much fun - cooking, 4 adults and one baby sleeping in a tent. Fear of bears, Bear storage, everything the atmosphere of housekeeping camp on july 4th weekend was so nice. We had fun. We'll probably stay sometime in Winter at Wawona. But for summer, it is definitely Housekeeping camp.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose House Keeping Camp because we wanted to stay on the valley floor and have the ability to cook or have a fire. We also wanted some place inexpensive to sleep. HKC is a great base camp because you are close to everything! We were able to quickly walk to Curry camp to eat, grab the shuttle or just stroll around and enjoy the scenery.
reviews.title: Rustic & peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a comfort hotel, it’s a step above camping in a tent but the views are spectacular and the staff is very helpful. We knew when we reserved the room that it was rustic and that the beds might not be the most comfortable but we didn’t care. We really wanted the experience of staying on the valley floor in Yosemite.
reviews.title: Housekeeping Camp is the best of Yosemite's 'basic' accommodation

likes.liked: — The location - don't expect anything luxurious here!
likes.disliked: — It is what it is - basic. Bring warm sleeping bags!

reviews.text: If you fly in to Stockton (which is what we did) and then drive to Yosemite to stay in HKC I would recommend packing a few extras that will make sleeping more comfortable. I knew from reading other reviews that an air mattress would be beneficial but we did not have room to pack that or the pump in our suitcase. The bed would have been more comfortable if we had & we might have been able to actually sleep. Now that we know we will leave room for the air mattress if we fly again! Also, a space heater would have been nice since the temp was in the low 40s at night. We rented the bed pack with the blankets, an extra blanket and 2 chairs to lounge in by the fire at night.
reviews.title: Outdoors/Indoors...Camping with perks

likes.liked: — camping with a few creature comforts

reviews.text: The only complaint is with the shower facility at HKC. Not all of them were working and some that were did not have shower curtains. Also, the hot water was difficult to turn on. You have to push the knob into the wall with all your strength and turn at the same time otherwise the knob just spins in circles.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

likes.disliked: — They place was filthy and rundown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Housekeeping as a last resort when we arrived at Yosemite on Memorial weekend without reservation !! WOW - the most amazing "last resort" i've ever had ! I wasn't keen on the idea of camping, but we stayed in tent 515 - right by the river with views of half dome. The 5* hotels we stayed in on the same trip just didn't compare to this!!!
reviews.title: Amazing, words can't describe

reviews.text: The "tent" has hard walls and plug sockets and is suprisingly comfortable. There's a cute table and bench for each one, a bear locker and bunk beds and a double bed.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: The showers were great and there's plenty of restrooms and amenities close by.
reviews.title: Good for those who don't mind roughing it a bit

reviews.text: I can't recommend this enough and next time we come (next year) we will definitely be staying here !!
reviews.title: Closest to camping without packing a tent or getting too dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it wasn't for the fact that this place is located in Yosemite Valley it wouldn't even get one star. We arrived at 1 pm and they told us we would have to wait until 3 to check in. I know hotels have a check in time but I've never been turned away from checking in early unless the room wasn't ready. This wasn't the case. Oh well. We went to our site anyway and got yelled at by the rent-a-ranger. Also, don't try to hang a hammock in the trees. We got busted for that too. It seems the only rules they don't enforce is putting out fires and making noise after 10. My only real problem with the place was the smoke from the campfires. It was so bad we decided to not make ours. I left the campground to get away from the smoke because it was so bad. Depending on your location (we were in the middle) the smoke can be horrible. It would be a health hazard for little kids. I left the city to breathe fresh air and I got more pollution in Yosemite! Go figure. The second night was better as there were much less campers. I found the place to be way overpriced ($89 after taxes). If you're going to charge that much then do some maintenance on the place, like changing the canvas on the rooms once every 10 years. They were covered in mold. Next time I'll camp and save some money or stay at curry village were they don't have fire pits. I will say that the showers at Housekeeping were nice and the store there was great. The staff at the store was very friendly. Despite my bad experience at Housekeeping we still had a wonderful time because hey, it's Yosemite!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in Housekeeping Camp May 5-9. We arrived late in the evening after the office had closed and found a note with a map directing us to our site. We had site 366 which is a riversite near the middle to the camp. We had enough luggage to fill the back of an SUV and were worried that we wouldn't be able to fit it in the bear box. But the bear boxes were surprisingly large and we had no problem at all.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: The beds slept our group of 4 adults comfortably. It was chilly at night (40s F) but our sleeping bags kept us warm. We did have a bear pass through the area of our campsite the first night, which made us nervous. We were glad to have used the bear boxes.
reviews.title: Good location - good alternative to tent camping

reviews.text: The location was great for touring the valley and we often used the shuttle which had a stop adjacent to the camp. We enjoyed walking to the beach and bridge. You can see Half Dome and Yosemite Falls from there and many other places in camp. We couldn't access the river directly from our site since the riverbank there was off limits to allow the plants to regenerate from heavy use I presume. But we still liked our location. It was quiet and uncrowded. We had neighbors sharing the duplex but they were not loud and we enjoyed talking to them.
reviews.title: Great place to see a Beautiful Park!!!

reviews.text: The only negative was the dust. All our stuff was very dirty by the end of our stay. I would recommended bringing a broom to sweep out the bear boxes and shelves before you use them
reviews.title: Love this place...will keep going back

likes.liked: — beautiful surroundings, great location on the valley

reviews.text: If I ever have the chance to return to Yosemite, Housekeeping will be my first choice for lodging. The location is great, the price is good, and the beds are fine. The light and electrical outlets make the structures quite an upgrade from tradional camping.
reviews.title: Great spot in the valley...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved our stay at Housekeeping - Yosemite is so beautiful, definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Housekeeping Camp has an amazing setting - it is nestled among huge pine trees by a beautiful river (with beach), all topped off by the towering peaks that surround the valley.
reviews.title: Amazing setting and fun experience

likes.liked: — Being in such an amazing natural setting

reviews.text: Yes, it's a bit dusty and pretty basic. But surely that's part of the fun?! - we really enjoyed a bit of an adventure and getting back to nature.
reviews.title: Camping without the tent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The toilet blocks and showers were very clean throughout our stay (there's no soap in them as that breaks the bear rules...) and there were no queues at all while we were there.
reviews.title: Absolutely disgusting and filthy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The huts/tents themselves are a bit old and battered, but the beds were surprisingly comfortable after a hard day's walking (we needed 4 blankets towards the end of Sep, but survived without sleeping bags).
reviews.title: Housekeeping Camp - a city like camping experience

likes.liked: — HKC offers the beautiful Merced River at the back
likes.disliked: — it feels like you never left the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got two different experiences - Sat night every single unit was full, and there was a fun, lively atmosphere - lots of music, campfires, big groups etc. However most noise died down by about 11pm and I had no problem sleeping (although earplugs helped!). Nearly everyone left on the Sunday so we then experienced a nearly empty camp which was also atmospheric, although in a much more quiet and peaceful way.
reviews.title: Camping made easy

aka: Housekeeping Camp Hotel Yosemite National Park
description: Tuesday August 27, 2013 - With the exception of White Wolf Lodge, all lodging and services are available in Yosemite National Park. Yosemite Valley and Wawona are largely unaffected by the Rim Fire and air quality is good.
